input: Hello doctor,I have been dealing with some issues lately regarding panic attacks. I am not sure what it is, but it is scary. I had three panic attacks in one day, or I think they are panic attacks. My fingers will twitch consistently then lock up and lose circulation, along with my whole arm, on both sides. My upper right lip will switch and my eye will too, then my cheek all while pulling my head back in the same motion.And all, while this is happening someone, will be trying to talk to me but I cannot speak, almost like being catatonic. I am a little skeptical about if they are panic attacks or not. Mainly because I usually have them when I am stressed, but I had two more again today, and I am not even stressing about anything.

My upper right lip will switch and my eye will too, then my cheek all while pulling my head back in the same motion.And all, while this is happening someone, will be trying to talk to me but I cannot speak, almost like being catatonic. ### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you are experiencing panic attacks. Panic attacks are sudden episodes of intense fear or discomfort, usually accompanied by physical symptoms such as rapid heartbeat, sweating, trembling, shortness of breath, and feelings of impending doom.

The symptoms you described, including twitching fingers, locked-up circulation in arms and legs, switching of upper lip and eye, and pulling back of the head, are consistent with some of the symptoms reported during panic attacks. These symptoms may also be associated with certain medical conditions, but based on your description, it is more likely that they are occurring during panic attacks.

It is important to note that panic attacks can occur even when not stressed, as you mentioned. Stress can trigger panic attacks in individuals who are already predisposed to them, but they can also occur spontaneously.

I would recommend seeking help from a healthcare professional, such as a psychologist or psychiatrist, who can evaluate your symptoms further and provide an accurate diagnosis. They can also help develop a treatment plan tailored to your needs.

input: Hello doctor,My 4 years old daughter has an inward turn in her right eye after concentrating for a while. We had an eye test recently. Can you tell me if her results mean she needs glasses as she keeps saying her eyes hurt watching television and readings of her results are: Right eye sph +1.50 cyl -0.50, left eye sph +1.50 cyl -0.50. They told me she is long sighted and we have a strong family history of squints and glasses. I do not know if I should get a second opinion.
raw_output:

They told me she is long sighted and we have a strong family history of squints and glasses. I do not know if I should get a second opinion.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it appears that your daughter has a condition known as accommodative esotropia. This is where the eye turns inward when concentrating on near tasks, such as reading or watching television. The results of her recent eye test indicate that she is long-sighted in both eyes (sph +1.50 cyl -0.50).

A squint or strabismus can often be associated with long-sightedness. In this case, the imbalance between the focusing power of the eyes and the distance of the objects being viewed can lead to the eye turn.

The need for glasses will depend on the severity of the esotropia and whether it is interfering with her vision. If her eyes are comfortable when watching television or reading, and there is no significant reduction in visual acuity, then glasses may not be immediately necessary. However, it is important to closely monitor her eye alignment and overall visual function.

Given the family history of squints and glasses, it would be advisable to seek a second opinion from another optometrist or ophthalmologist. They can provide further evaluation and guidance regarding treatment options, which may include glasses, patching, or possibly surgical intervention.

It is always important to address any concerns regarding your child's vision, so seeking a second opinion would be recommended in this case.

input: Hello doctor,My baby is 2 months old. He is on pumped milk and once a day formula milk (Enfamil). He is gassy and cries mostly from evening till midnight. Spits up even after burping for 30 minutes. I give exercise, and tummy time, but there is no change. He gets reflux which makes him uncomfortable.His spits are watery. My pediatrician suggested Colicaid and Yamoo which I am using four times a day. Still, he gets gas and spits up. And now he did not poop for the past two days and trying very hard and cries in between feeds by trying to poop. Is this an effect of enzymes? Please help.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,My baby is 2 months old. He is on pumped milk and once a day formula milk (Enfamil). He is gassy and cries mostly from evening till midnight. Spits up even after burping for 30 minutes. I give exercise, and tummy time, but there is no change. He gets reflux which makes him uncomfortable.His spits are watery. My pediatrician suggested Colicaid and Yamoo which I am using four times a day. Still, he gets gas and spits up. And now he did not poop for the past two days and trying very hard and cries in between feeds by trying to poop. Is this an effect of enzymes? Please help.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it seems like your baby is experiencing symptoms of gastroesophageal reflux (GER) and possible lactose intolerance.

For the gas and spitting up, one possible cause could be an excessive amount of foremilk being consumed during feedings. Foremilk is rich in lactose and tends to be thicker than hindmilk, which contains more fats and is easier for some babies to digest. If your baby is getting mostly foremilk due to inefficient milk transfer or overeating, it can lead to discomfort and increased spitting up.

To address this, you can try the following steps:

1. Ensure proper latch: Consult with a lactation consultant to ensure your baby has a good latch and is effectively draining the breast during feeding.
2. Efficient feeding technique: Encourage your baby to take a break between breast sessions to prevent overeating. This will allow for more hindmilk production and reduce the chances of excessive gas buildup.
3. Watch portion sizes: Monitor how much your baby is consuming during each feeding session. If they seem to be overly full or showing signs of discomfort, consider offering smaller amounts more frequently rather than one large feeding.
4.

He said it appeared small and not significant, but it was adviced that I should come back in six months for a comparative X-ray and that it could just be a scar from an earlier infection.I have read that a small scar area is probably non-progressive but I have also read about IPF, and that fills me with fear. ### Response:Based on the information provided, it is difficult to determine whether the scar in your lower left lung is progressive or not. Scars in the lungs can be caused by various factors, including infections and diseases like pulmonary fibrosis (PF).

While it is true that some scars in the lungs can be non-progressive, it is also possible for them to represent underlying lung disease, such as idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). IPF is a progressive lung disease that causes scarring of the lung tissue, leading to breathing difficulties.

To determine whether the scar is progressive or not, further evaluation is needed. This may include a high-resolution CT scan of the chest, which provides more detailed images of the lungs. Additionally, a follow-up consultation with a pulmonologist would be advisable.

It is important not to panic, as not all lung scars are progressive. However, it is essential to have a thorough evaluation to ensure proper diagnosis and appropriate management.

2. Avoid foods that may trigger nausea such as spicy, greasy, or strong-smelling foods.
3. Stay hydrated by drinking small amounts of fluids frequently.
4. Try eating bland foods like crackers, toast, or rice.
5. Sit in an upright position after meals to reduce the likelihood of acid reflux or heartburn.
6. Use ginger in any form (such as ginger tea, ginger candies, or ginger capsules) as it may help relieve nausea.

input: Hi doctor,I had an extraction of a molar in the morning, and a bone graft was placed over it. My surgeon placed a collagen plug over it to make the graft to stay in place. Can I have a blood clot below it? I am afraid of getting a dry socket. Last time, I had a dry socket, when I had a wisdom tooth removal, and I am scared. Please help.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I had an extraction of a molar in the morning, and a bone graft was placed over it. My surgeon placed a collagen plug over it to make the graft to stay in place. Can I have a blood clot below it? I am afraid of getting a dry socket. Last time, I had a dry socket, when I had a wisdom tooth removal, and I am scared. Please help.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it is possible to develop a blood clot below the bone graft after a tooth extraction. The collagen plug placed by your surgeon is intended to help prevent the graft from shifting or becoming dislodged. 

Dry socket, also known as alveolar osteitis, is a common complication following tooth extraction. ### Instruction:

I am not using any medications right now.Basic Details: Male, 25 years old, 5\11", 154 lbs. Please suggest me medications to prevent hair loss and regrow my hair. Any help would be appreciated.

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like you are experiencing male pattern baldness or androgenetic alopecia. This condition is caused by a combination of genetic and hormonal factors and typically affects the front and top of the head.

Unfortunately, there is no definitive cure for male pattern baldness, but there are medications available that can help slow down or prevent further hair loss. One such medication is finasteride, which works by inhibiting the conversion of testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT), a hormone that contributes to hair loss.

Minoxidil is another option that can be used to stimulate hair growth. It is available over-the-counter as a topical solution or foam and may help promote hair regrowth in some individuals.

However, it's important to note that these medications may not work for everyone, and results can vary. It would be best to consult with a dermatologist or a trichologist who can evaluate your condition more thoroughly and provide personalized recommendations based on your specific needs.

Please remember that self-diagnosis and self-medication can have potential risks, so it's always advisable to seek professional medical advice before starting any medications or treatment plans.

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like you are experiencing ankle swelling after starting a new jogging routine. This could be a sign of an injury or overuse. Ankle swelling can have various causes, including inflammation, increased fluid accumulation, or damage to blood vessels.

Here are a few possible causes for your ankle swelling:

1. Ankle sprain: Jogging can put stress on the ankles, making them more prone to sprains. A sprained ankle may cause swelling, pain, and difficulty walking.
2. Ankle tendonitis: Inflammation of the tendons in the ankle can result from repetitive movements like jogging. This can lead to pain and swelling.
3. Peripheral edema: Sitting for long periods can increase the risk of fluid accumulation in the ankles, resulting in swelling. This may be more noticeable when standing and walking.

To address the swelling, you can try the following:

1. Rest and avoid excessive exercise: Give your ankles adequate time to heal. Reduce or avoid activities that worsen the swelling.
2. Apply ice packs: Use an ice pack wrapped in a cloth for 15-20 minutes at a time, several times a day

### Response:Based on your description, there are several possible reasons for the bleeding after sex. Here are a few possibilities:

1. Hormonal changes: It is common for some women to experience hormonal changes and slight bleeding during sexual intercourse during the initial stages of pregnancy. This can occur due to the increase in hormone levels.

2. Inadequate lubrication: Insufficient vaginal lubrication can lead to irritation and small tears in the vaginal tissues, resulting in bleeding after intercourse.

3. Infection: Certain infections, such as bacterial vaginosis or trichomoniasis, can cause inflammation and irritation of the genital area, leading to postcoital bleeding.

4. Sexual trauma: If there was any form of trauma during sexual intercourse, it could result in tearing of the vaginal tissues, causing bleeding.

It is important for your wife to consult a healthcare professional to determine the exact cause of the bleeding. The doctor will conduct a thorough examination and may order additional tests if necessary.

input: Hello doctor,Does Methamphetamine interfere with local anesthesia? My friend was told she would not have to stop Adderall before surgery. I know that is not the same, but is there anything particularly dangerous about methamphetamine and local anesthesia? What about Phentermine?
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,Does Methamphetamine interfere with local anesthesia? My friend was told she would not have to stop Adderall before surgery. I know that is not the same, but is there anything particularly dangerous about methamphetamine and local anesthesia? What about Phentermine?

### Response:Methamphetamine and Phentermine are both stimulant medications that can have an impact on the body's response to local anesthesia. Both drugs can increase heart rate, blood pressure, and metabolism, which may interfere with the effectiveness of local anesthetics.

Local anesthesia is used to numb specific areas of the body for surgical procedures or dental work. The goal is to block nerve signals and prevent pain sensations. Stimulant medications like methamphetamine and phentermine can interfere with the ability of local anesthetics to work effectively by blocking the same neurotransmitters that these medications target.

It is generally recommended to stop using stimulant medications before any surgical procedure or dental work involving local anesthesia. This allows the local anesthesia to work optimally and provides better control over the area being numbed.

However, it is important to note that each individual case may vary depending on the dosage, duration of use, and overall health status of the patient. It would be best to consult with your healthcare provider or the surgeon directly for specific advice regarding the use of methamphetamine or phentermine before surgery.

Considering her symptoms, medical history, and test results, it would be best to consult with a pulmonologist or respiratory specialist for further evaluation and management of her condition. They will be able to provide appropriate treatment options, such as bronchodilators, corticosteroids, and other medications to manage her COPD symptoms and improve her respiratory function.

4. Avoid strenuous activities: Resting and avoiding excessive movement can help reduce the swelling. It's important to give your body enough time to heal.

5. If symptoms worsen or don't improve: It's important

1. Precautions: 
- Avoid activities that strain your elbow joint, especially repetitive movements like playing badminton heavily.
- Take regular breaks during play to rest your arm and elbow.
- Use proper technique and equipment when playing sports to minimize stress on the elbow.
- Consider using a different racquet or changing your grip to reduce strain on the elbow.
- Improve your overall strength and conditioning to better support your arms and shoulders.

2. Exercises:
- Gentle stretching exercises can help improve flexibility and relieve tension in the muscles around the elbow.
- Try extending your arm forward with your palm up and then slowly bending your elbow to bring your hand behind your back. Hold for 15-30 seconds and repeat several times throughout the day.
- Another exercise is to extend your arm straight backward with your palm facing up, and then slowly bend your elbow to bring your hand towards your shoulder blade. Hold for 15-30 seconds and repeat several times.
- You can also try wall climbing exercises where you hold onto a wall at chest height and slowly lift your hand towards the wall, then lower it back down.

input: Hello doctor,Would NorLevo pill work if a female has taken Ecstasy pill and after 10 hours she takes the morning-after pill. Will this have an effect or not? Please, can you advise me on this and ovulation? And also, how long does it take a female to fall pregnant?

### Input:
Hello doctor,Would NorLevo pill work if a female has taken Ecstasy pill and after 10 hours she takes the morning-after pill. Will this have an effect or not? Please, can you advise me on this and ovulation? And also, how long does it take a female to fall pregnant?

### Response:As a doctor, I can provide some information regarding your questions.

1. Will NorLevo pill work if a female has taken Ecstasy pill and after 10 hours she takes the morning-after pill?
The effectiveness of emergency contraception (such as NorLevo) may be reduced if taken shortly after using drugs like Ecstasy. This is because the hormonal methods of emergency contraception rely on the presence of ovulation and regular hormone levels, which may be disrupted by drug use. It is recommended to use emergency contraception as soon as possible after unprotected intercourse, ideally within 72 hours, but certainly within a week. However, it is always best to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice in your specific situation.

2. Can you advise me on ovulation?
Ovulation refers to the release of an egg from the ovaries during the menstrual cycle. It typically occurs around day 14 in a 28-day cycle, but can vary from woman to woman. To determine your most fertile days and assess your risk of pregnancy, it is important to understand your menstrual cycle and track basal body temperature, cervical mucus changes, and hormone levels.

3. How long does it take for a female to fall pregnant?
The average couple takes

input: Hello doctor,I feel a tight band like pressure around my head while wearing specs. I try not to flinch my head muscles while feeling the head pressure fearing it will escalate the pressure feeling. I started wearing specs from the age of 16, and now I am 19. I do not want to wear contact lenses and cannot go for LASIK because of keratoconus in my right eye. When can I get rid of this feeling or get a proper way of coping with it?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I feel a tight band like pressure around my head while wearing specs. I try not to flinch my head muscles while feeling the head pressure fearing it will escalate the pressure feeling. I started wearing specs from the age of 16, and now I am 19. I do not want to wear contact lenses and cannot go for LASIK because of keratoconus in my right eye. When can I get rid of this feeling or get a proper way of coping with it?

### Response:Based on your description, the tight band-like pressure around your head while wearing glasses could be due to a condition called ocular hypertonicity. This can occur when the muscles in your eyes are constantly under tension, leading to discomfort and pain.

Unfortunately, there is no way to completely rid of this feeling without addressing the underlying cause. However, there are some strategies that may help you cope with the discomfort:

1. Take regular breaks: Frequently give your eyes a rest by removing your glasses and closing your eyes for a few minutes. This can help reduce muscle tension.
2. Practice relaxation techniques: Stress and tension can worsen the symptoms. Consider practicing relaxation techniques such as deep breathing exercises or meditation to help manage stress and promote relaxation in your eyes.
3. Use computer glasses: Consider using specialized glasses specifically designed for computer use. These glasses have a specific prescription that helps reduce eye strain and muscle tension that occurs from prolonged screen time.
4. Adjust your glasses: Make sure your current glasses fit properly and are not too tight or pressing against your head too much. An ill-fitting pair can exacerbate the discomfort.

It's important to consult with an optometrist or ophthalmologist

input: Hello doctor,I have been on Lo Loestrin Fe for four months. I have never missed the pills on any days. I started to develop pregnancy symptoms such as nausea, food aversion, breast tenderness, dizziness, crying and fatigue. I stopped taking the pill and took three pregnancy tests in the morning using fresh urine. All the pregnancy tests were negative and I have been bleeding bright red blood for a day. I have to change the tampon every three to four hours. I am still experiencing nausea, food aversion and have chills. I am not running a fever. I had experienced similar symptoms before also on a 30 mg combined birth control pill. That time, the symptoms resolved when I stopped using the pills. Though my urine pregnancy tests are negative, will these symptoms suggest that I am pregnant?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:

I started to develop pregnancy symptoms such as nausea, food aversion, breast tenderness, dizziness, crying and fatigue. I stopped taking the pill and took three pregnancy tests in the morning using fresh urine. All the pregnancy tests were negative and I have been bleeding bright red blood for a day. I have to change the tampon every three to four hours. I am still experiencing nausea, food aversion and have chills. I am not running a fever. I had experienced similar symptoms before also on a 30 mg combined birth control pill. That time, the symptoms resolved when I stopped using the pills. Though my urine pregnancy tests are negative, will these symptoms suggest that I am pregnant?

### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you may be experiencing symptoms of pregnancy despite the negative results on the urine pregnancy tests. Pregnancy symptoms such as nausea, food aversion, breast tenderness, dizziness, crying, and fatigue can occur even if you are not pregnant. However, the bright red bleeding and frequent tampon changes could be indicative of implantation bleeding, which sometimes occurs when a fertilized egg attaches to the uterine lining.

To determine if you are pregnant, it is recommended that you take a blood pregnancy test at your healthcare provider's office. This test will detect the presence of the hormone hCG (human chorionic gonadotropin) which increases significantly in the blood during early pregnancy.

Please consult with your healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

input: Hi doctor,I am 35 years old and my weight is 56 kg. My daughter is 3 years 3 months old. My doctor advised me to take one Femilon tablet daily from the first day of my period for contraception purpose. Last day of my period was 22nd of last month. At 21st night of this month, I felt that my period has started and took one tablet at bedtime. But, yesterday and today I got only spotting and the period has not started properly. I am continuing the tablet regularly at night for the last two days. Should I continue to take the tablet regularly till completion of the pack of 21? Will protection start from the first month or do we have to use extra protection like a condom? Should I start taking a fresh pack on the first day of every period?

2. Protection: The pill provides effective contraception once you have taken it regularly for a few days. However, if you experience breakthrough bleeding, it is recommended to use additional barrier methods such as condoms until the bleeding stops. This will provide extra protection against pregnancy.

Fresh pack on the first day of every period: Typically, the pill is taken in a cycle where you have a menstrual period for a few days, followed by taking the pills continuously for the rest of the month. After the last pill of the pack, you will have a withdrawal bleed (similar to a period) before starting the next pack. Therefore, it is not necessary to start a fresh pack on the first day of every period.

However, it is important to follow the instructions provided by your doctor or pharmacist regarding the usage of the pill

input: Hi doctor,I have irregular periods with very heavy bleeding, clots, cramps, stabbing pains in my pelvic area with no pattern connecting to bleeding. Some days, I am so fatigue and cannot function. This started five years ago. I had constant bleeding following coil insertion. Then it was removed and had a miscarriage at six weeks. When I was pregnant, there was no bleeding but had spotting throughout. Since delivery I am suffering again with irregular and heavy bleeds. It became worse for the past eight months. I have IBS which is stress related. I am taking Adalat for high blood pressure, which is under control. I was prescribed Mefenamic acid and Tranexamic acid as I refused coil due to previous bleeding with one and refused Esmya due to side effects. My transvaginal ultrasound found two polycystic ovaries and bulky adenomyotic looking anteverted uterus vascular ++ on anterior wall. The size was 2 x 3 x 0.9 cm. There are no fibroids or polyps or other pelvic masses or free fluid. Then what is it?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I have irregular periods with very heavy bleeding, clots, cramps, stabbing pains in my pelvic area with no pattern connecting to bleeding. Some days, I am so fatigue and cannot function. This started five years ago. I had constant bleeding following coil insertion. Then it was removed and had a miscarriage at six weeks. When I was pregnant, there was no bleeding but had spotting throughout. Since delivery I am suffering again with irregular and heavy bleeds. It became worse for the past eight months. I have IBS which is stress related. I am taking Adalat for high blood pressure, which is under control. I was prescribed Mefenamic acid and Tranexamic acid as I refused coil due to previous bleeding with one and refused Esmya due to side effects. My transvaginal ultrasound found two polycystic ovaries and bulky adenomyotic looking anteverted uterus vascular ++ on anterior wall. The size was 2 x 3 x 0.9 cm. There are no fibroids or polyps or other pelvic masses or free fluid. Then what is it?

### Response:Based on the patient's description, it seems like she is experiencing symptoms of a condition called adenomyosis. Adenomyosis is a type of endometriosis where the tissue that normally lines the uterus (endometrium) grows into the muscular wall of the uterus (myometrium). Following a frenectomy, orthodontic treatment may be necessary to further move the teeth and improve alignment. 1. Peripheral neuropathy: This condition involves damage to the peripheral nerves, which can lead to numbness, tingling, or pain in the extremities like the feet. It can have various causes, including diabetes, vitamin deficiencies, certain medications, or nerve compression.

3. Musculoskeletal issues: Foot pain can also be due to muscle strains, ligament sprains, or other injuries. This could potentially explain the foot ache you are experiencing.

input: Hello doctor,How accurate in your opinion is the Lelli ACL (Lever test)? I am almost three months post-op of having my ACL reconstructed along with a few lesions addressed during the surgery. I am concerned I have ruptured my ACL again after feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation. It has been three days since the incident and the knee now feels a lot looser and I have some pain in different areas. I have tried the Lachman test with no noticeable shifting, and the Lelli test was positive with good leverage hopefully assisted by my intact ACL. I will have to see my surgeon and physio soon but I am just wondering how accurate the Lelli test is. There seems to be no difference when comparing the test in both knees.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,How accurate in your opinion is the Lelli ACL (Lever test)? I am almost three months post-op of having my ACL reconstructed along with a few lesions addressed during the surgery. I am concerned I have ruptured my ACL again after feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation. It has been three days since the incident and the knee now feels a lot looser and I have some pain in different areas. I have tried the Lachman test with no noticeable shifting, and the Lelli test was positive with good leverage hopefully assisted by my intact ACL. I will have to see my surgeon and physio soon but I am just wondering how accurate the Lelli test is. There seems to be no difference when comparing the test in both knees.

### Response:The Lelli ACL test, also known as the Lever sign test, is a commonly used clinical examination to assess the integrity of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL). It involves applying a specific amount of force to the tibia while the knee is in extension and rotating the tibia medially. The test is considered highly accurate in detecting ACL injuries.

In your case, if you experienced a short sharp pain during the incident and are now feeling a looser knee and pain in different areas, it is important to consider the possibility of ACL rupture. The positive Lelli test with good leverage suggests that the ACL may be intact. However, it is essential to consult with your surgeon and physiotherapist for further evaluation and management.

Additional tests such as the Lachman test, which did not show noticeable shifting in your case, can provide additional information but may not be as sensitive as the Lelli test for detecting ACL injuries. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) may also be considered to confirm the diagnosis and assess the extent of the injury.

It is crucial to seek professional medical advice to determine the best course of action for your specific situation.

### Input:
Hello doctor,If a person is allergic to seafood, can they swim in the ocean? This person cannot touch seafood or have sea-salt either.

### Response:If a person is allergic to seafood, it is generally safe for them to swim in the ocean. Allergic reactions to seafood are usually caused by consuming or coming into direct contact with the proteins found in seafood. Swimming in the ocean does not pose a significant risk of exposure to these allergens because the concentrations of seafood proteins in the water are typically very low. However, it is still advisable for individuals with seafood allergies to exercise caution and avoid known allergens as much as possible. They should be aware of the potential presence of sea life such as jellyfish or certain crustaceans that might indirectly expose them to seafood allergens. It is also important to note that a person with a severe seafood allergy should always carry their auto-injectable epinephrine device (such as an EpiPen) when swimming or engaging in any aquatic activities in case of an emergency.

Here are a few possible causes for your recurring swelling:

1. Tooth infection: A cavity or crack in a tooth can allow bacteria to enter and infect the pulp, leading to an abscess.
2. Gum infection: An abscess can also develop if gum tissue becomes infected, possibly due to poor oral hygiene or periodontal disease.
3. Oral fracture: If you recently experienced trauma to your mouth, such as a broken tooth, it can lead to an abscess.

To treat the dental abscess, you will need to see a dentist for further evaluation and appropriate treatment. The dentist may perform a root canal procedure to remove the infected pulp and clean out the abscess. In some cases, an oral surgeon may be needed to drain the abscess if it is large or not accessible to the dentist.

It is important to seek professional care promptly to prevent the infection from spreading and causing more complications.

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like the Hexidine mouthwash has caused discoloration of your teeth. Hexidine is known to cause temporary brownish discoloration of the teeth, which can last for a few days to a few weeks. However, if the discoloration persists for a longer period of time or worsens, it is important to consult a dentist.

In the meantime, you can try the following steps to help clean your teeth and minimize the appearance of discoloration:

1. Rinse your mouth thoroughly with water after using the Hexidine mouthwash.
2. Avoid consuming foods and beverages that can stain your teeth, such as coffee, tea, red wine, and berries.
3. Brush your teeth regularly using a soft-bristled toothbrush and fluoride toothpaste.
4. Consider using a whitening toothpaste or a gentle whitening strip system approved by your dentist.

It's important to note that these measures may help improve the appearance of your teeth temporarily but will not reverse the underlying discoloration caused by the Hexidine mouthwash. Therefore, it is advisable to schedule an appointment with a dentist to evaluate the extent of the discoloration and discuss other possible treatments or whitening options.

input: Hello doctor,I had suffered from common cold symptoms three months back. It resolved completely in about 18 to 19 days. But the medicine did not work. However, previously whenever I experienced a runny nose and constant sneezing, one Cetirizine tablet helped.In fact, it resolved the problem. To further evaluate your condition, I would recommend consulting with a healthcare professional who specializes in hormone replacement therapy or andrology. They will be able to provide a comprehensive assessment and determine if testosterone replacement therapy is appropriate for you.

I am not able to concentrate on anything for the past four years. As soon I as I enter the office I feel very uncomfortable. During meeting while sitting in a small quiet room, I feel very stressed and wanted to break everything and run out. Please help me overcome this.

### Response:I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue. Based on your description, it seems like you may be suffering from a condition called gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). GERD occurs when stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing symptoms such as gurgling noises, discomfort, and stress.

Here are a few suggestions that may help alleviate your symptoms:

1. Diet modifications: Avoid trigger foods and beverages that can worsen symptoms, such as fatty or fried foods, caffeine, alcohol, and acidic foods like citrus fruits and tomatoes. Instead, opt for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains.

2. Elevate the head of your bed: Place blocks underneath the headboard or use a wedge pillow to elevate your head while sleeping. This can help prevent stomach acid from flowing back into your esophagus during the night.

3. Lifestyle changes: Try to manage stress levels by practicing relaxation techniques like deep breathing exercises, meditation, or yoga. Additionally, consider taking regular breaks during the day to step away from your desk and move around if possible.

4.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it seems that your child has a large eyeball size and myopia (-4 power). The doctor mentioned that at this stage, there is nothing that can be done and recommended following up in six months.

It is important to note that the progression of myopia is variable and unpredictable in children. While it is true that the eyes may stabilize or slow down their growth over time, it is difficult to predict if and when this will happen.

In terms of controlling myopia progression, there are various approaches that can be considered. These include:

1. Regular eye check-ups: It is essential to monitor your child's eye health and refractive error at regular intervals as recommended by the doctor.

2. Orthokeratology (Ortho-K): This involves wearing special contact lenses overnight to reshape the cornea and temporarily correct myopia. Ortho-K may help slow down the progression of myopia, but it may not be suitable for all children.

3. Atropine therapy: Atropine eye drops can be used to temporarily dilate the pupil, which may slow down the elongation of the eyeball associated with myopia. However, the long-term effects and safety of atropine use in children are still being studied.

input: Hello doctor,I was born half blind in one eye. I have been through a stressful few months and it has all caught up with me now with headaches and anxiety-like symptoms, etc. I noticed during this time, that my \x80\x9cgood eye\x80\x9d became hazy/blurry and became quite sensitive to light. This has gone back to normal vision. I noticed that it is now affecting my \x80\x9cbad eye.\x80\x9d I woke up a few days ago quite dizzy and did not know what was going on. I am wondering if it happened then? As I have gone my whole life like this so maybe my body is confused? I am also worried because I am unsure of whether the vision in the \x80\x9cbad eye\x80\x9d will return to its normal state. This makes me dizzy at times and I think it gets worse when I am nervous about it which might be why I get dizzy?

I have been through a stressful few months and it has all caught up with me now with headaches and anxiety-like symptoms, etc. I noticed during this time, that my \x80\x9cgood eye\x80\x9d became hazy/blurry and became quite sensitive to light. This has gone back to normal vision. I noticed that it is now affecting my \x80\x9cbad eye.\x80\x9d I woke up a few days ago quite dizzy and did not know what was going on. This makes me dizzy at times and I think it gets worse when I am nervous about it which might be why I get dizzy?

### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you are experiencing a condition called acute angle-closure glaucoma. This occurs when there is a sudden increase in intraocular pressure due to the closure of the drainage angle in the eye.

The symptoms you described, such as hazy/blurry vision, sensitivity to light, dizziness, and visual disturbances in both eyes, are consistent with this condition. Acute angle-closure glaucoma can cause a sudden rise in intraocular pressure, leading to optic nerve damage and visual impairment.

It is important to seek immediate medical attention from an ophthalmologist or go to the nearest emergency department. Treatment typically involves laser therapy or medication to reduce intraocular pressure and prevent further damage. Eye drops may also be prescribed to relieve symptoms.

Please consult a healthcare professional as soon as possible to evaluate and manage your condition appropriately.

### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you are experiencing shoulder impingement. Shoulder impingement occurs when the tendons of the rotator cuff muscles and the bursa (fluid-filled sac) in the shoulder are compressed and irritated as they pass through the narrow space between the acromion (bony projection of the shoulder blade) and the humeral head (upper arm bone). This can cause pain, especially during movements that involve raising your arms overhead or throwing objects.

Paracetamol can help reduce pain and inflammation, but it is important to address the underlying cause of the symptoms. I would recommend seeking medical advice from a healthcare professional, such as a doctor or a physiotherapist, who can perform a thorough examination of your shoulder and may order imaging studies like an X-ray or an MRI if necessary. They will be able to provide a more accurate diagnosis and suggest appropriate treatment options, which may include physical therapy exercises, anti-inflammatory medications, or in some cases, surgical intervention.

input: Hi doctor,I am taking Larin Fe as a birth control pill. It is a combined monophasic pill with three weeks of active pills and one week of inactive pills. I currently started pill packs a week back but wanted to change it to a weekend to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding. How can I do so without losing the effectiveness of the pill? My idea was to wait until my placebo week which starts on a weekday and then to take the placebos only up until weekend and start a new pack then. Would this work without changing the effectiveness of my pill?
raw_output:

Hi doctor,I am taking Larin Fe as a birth control pill. It is a combined monophasic pill with three weeks of active pills and one week of inactive pills. I currently started pill packs a week back but wanted to change it to a weekend to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding. How can I do so without losing the effectiveness of the pill? My idea was to wait until my placebo week which starts on a weekday and then to take the placebos only up until weekend and start a new pack then. Would this work without changing the effectiveness of my pill?

### Response:As a doctor, I can provide some guidance on your question. Changing the timing of your pill packs to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding is possible, but it's important to maintain the effectiveness of the pill. Here's what you can do:

1. Start by completing your current pack normally, regardless of the day of the week. This means taking the active pills for three weeks followed by the inactive pills for one week.

2. After completing the inactive pills, start a new pack on the following day (regardless of the day of the week). Take the active pills from this pack for three weeks.

3. During the fourth week, which will be the following weekend, skip the inactive pills and continue taking the active pills as usual.

4. After the fourth week, start a new pack on the following day (regardless of the day of the week). Take the active pills from this pack for three weeks.

By following this schedule, you will be taking the active pills consistently and avoiding weekend withdrawal bleeding. This should not affect the effectiveness of your birth control pill.

It's important to note that every individual is different, and it's always best to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized advice based on your specific situation.

input: Hi doctor,I have done an eye test recently, and I found that I need a cylindrical correction too. Earlier I used spectacles only with spherical correction. My test results show 6/18, -1.25 DC \xc3\x97 95, 6/6 and 6/9, -0.25/-0.75 \xc3\x97 75, 6/6. I would like to know whether my eye power is too weak. My test results show 6/18, -1.25 DC \xc3\x97 95, 6/6 and 6/9, -0.25/-0.75 \xc3\x97 75, 6/6. I would like to know whether my eye power is too weak. ### Response:Based on the information provided, it appears that you have astigmatism in addition to nearsightedness. The cylindrical correction refers to the power needed to correct this astigmatism. 

Astigmatism is a common eye condition where the cornea is shaped more like a football instead of a round ball, causing blurred vision at all distances. The "-1.25 DC @ 95" part of your prescription indicates the cylindrical power and the axis angle. The axis angle refers to the direction of the astigmatism.

Spectacles with spherical correction alone would not be able to correct for astigmatism. Therefore, it is not surprising that you now need a cylindrical correction.

The other way to correct cylindrical power apart from spectacles is through contact lenses. Contact lenses can provide more precise correction compared to glasses, especially for higher degrees of astigmatism.

It is important to note that eye power can vary from person to person, and there is no universal standard for determining whether someone's eye power is weak. Eye power is unique to each individual and depends on various factors such as age, refractive error, and overall eye health.

I would recommend discussing these test results with your optometrist or ophthalmologist to determine the best course of action for your specific situation

Marrying a girl with the same blood group (in this case, A+) does not necessarily cause problems or reduce the genetic pool. The risk of genetic defects or abnormalities in offspring is generally associated with consanguineous marriages (marriages between close relatives), not just similar blood types.

It's important to consider that even in consanguineous marriages, many couples have healthy and normal children without genetic defects. The decision to marry and start a family should be based on individual circumstances, personal preferences, and discussions with healthcare professionals.

input: Hi doctor,I have been taking 4 mg of Xanax a day to treat severe panic attack syndrome and associated high levels of general anxiety for 15 years. My doctor arrived at the 4 mg per day amount gradually and it works very well along with CBT from a therapist. Before two months, when I received the medication from the pharmacy it was for 3 mg /day. I asked them to double check and that was the quantity that my doctor had written. I call his office and the office manager said that she would ask him about it. When I called the next day she said that he did not make a mistake and I asked for an explanation and was told that he did not give one.I started to feel sick a few days later and panic attacks actually started to increase the day that I talk to his office manager. I suffered minor but disruptive withdrawal symptoms physically and mentally for about two weeks and then they subsided but panic attacks continued to occur at random every day and my GAD symptoms increased to the point where CBT methods were not working.Then last month, the script was back to 4 mg per day normal dosage. I thought yes, back to normal. But again this month the script was back down to 3 mg per day which means I am going to experience a minor hell again.I am a defense and aerospace engineer who works on a contract basis through an agency and the client had noticed a drop in my performance before month but back to normal last month, now they are going to see it again and I will probably lose the contract job. I also started online system engineer classes and I am freaking out over being able to handle the exams and homework as I typically work on the class at night and am now without my evening dose. I again asked for an explanation and was not given any.My question is a 25% cut in dosage physically dangerous and I am well aware of the strong psychological addition issues, so will this settle down before my career and social life and general well being take a hit and I revert to hiding in my apartment with my dog and my employer and friends will give up on me.

### Response:Based on your description, the white spot beneath your tongue and the white area inside your cheek could be leukoplakia. Leukoplakia is a condition characterized by the development of white or grayish-white patches in the mouth. It is often associated with irritation or inflammation caused by tobacco use, including gutkha/pan masala.

While leukoplakia is usually painless and not cancerous, it can potentially become precancerous or progress to oral cancer if left untreated. Therefore, it is important to seek medical attention and consult with a healthcare professional, such as a doctor or a dentist, who can further evaluate the lesion and provide appropriate treatment recommendations.

I would advise you to make an appointment with your doctor or a dentist as soon as possible to have the white spot and white area inside your cheek examined and diagnosed correctly. instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,I am unable to bear weight on my healed ankle. I had a fracture of the same ankle four years ago. This problem has been there since six months. Climbing stairs is a problem. I get pain inside my bone, sharp stabbing pain and some burning sensation. This stabbing pain stays for a week or so with no movement and goes away after a week of rest, but returns when I climb stairs (put weight on the ankle). The bone is feeling sore all the time. Please advice. The x-ray and MRI reports are normal.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I am unable to bear weight on my healed ankle. I had a fracture of the same ankle four years ago. This problem has been there since six months. Climbing stairs is a problem. I get pain inside my bone, sharp stabbing pain and some burning sensation. This stabbing pain stays for a week or so with no movement and goes away after a week of rest, but returns when I climb stairs (put weight on the ankle). The bone is feeling sore all the time. Please advice. The x-ray and MRI reports are normal.

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like you may be experiencing a condition called chronic exertional compartment syndrome (CECS) in your ankle. CECS is characterized by pain, swelling, and weakness in a specific muscle group during exercise.

The symptoms you described, such as inability to bear weight on the healed ankle, climbing stairs being a problem, sharp stabbing pain inside the bone, burning sensation, and soreness all the time, are consistent with CECS.

To confirm the diagnosis, I would recommend seeing a sports medicine specialist or a physician who specializes in foot and ankle injuries. They may suggest further tests such as nerve conduction studies or electromyography (EMG) to assess the nerve function and muscle activity in the affected area.

In the meantime, it is important to avoid activities that exacerbate the symptoms and consider physical therapy exercises to strengthen the muscles around the ankle. If conservative measures fail to provide relief, your healthcare provider may consider surgical interventions like decompression surgery to relieve pressure on the affected nerves and muscles.

Please consult with a medical professional for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment plan.

input: Hello doctor,I am 33-year-old male, healthy, and have no current or previous skin conditions.1) I am about to start utilizing Tretinoin 0.025 % to apply to my face to get a head start and keep fine lines and wrinkles at bay. There is a product that is a moisturizer that comes with Vitamin C and has glycolic acid, would that be ok to use after applying Tretinoin at nights.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am 33-year-old male, healthy, and have no current or previous skin conditions.1) I am about to start utilizing Tretinoin 0.025 % to apply to my face to get a head start and keep fine lines and wrinkles at bay. There is a product that is a moisturizer that comes with Vitamin C and has glycolic acid, would that be ok to use after applying Tretinoin at nights.

### Response:As a doctor, I can provide some guidance on your question.

Tretinoin is a retinoid medication commonly used to treat acne and wrinkles. It helps to promote cell turnover and improve skin texture. However, it can also increase skin sensitivity and cause irritation.

Glycolic acid is a type of alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) that is commonly used in skincare products to exfoliate the skin and improve its appearance. Vitamin C is also beneficial for the skin as it has antioxidant properties.

In general, it is recommended to avoid using other exfoliants or products with AHAs while using tretinoin, as they can increase the risk of irritation. However, if used cautiously and sparingly, you may be able to incorporate a vitamin C serum into your routine after applying tretinoin at nights.

It is important to do a patch test first to check for any adverse reactions or irritation. Apply a small amount of the vitamin C serum on a small area of your skin, such as the inner side of your forearm, and monitor for any redness, irritation, or peeling. If there are no issues after a few days, you can gradually increase the frequency and concentration of the vitamin C serum.

Rem

### Response:Based on the information provided, it is difficult to determine if you have diabetes or not. The American Diabetes Association (ADA) defines diabetes as fasting blood glucose levels of 126 mg/dL or higher on two different occasions, or a random blood glucose level of 200 mg/dL or higher, or a glycated hemoglobin (A1C) level of 6.5% or higher.

input: Hi doctor,I got a stroke but I do not know how to explain it. Twice I was bleeding along with the stroke. One type of bleeding was chronic and the other one was acute. I would like to know which type of bleeding is dangerous? And also explain the reason for the same.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I got a stroke but I do not know how to explain it. Twice I was bleeding along with the stroke. One type of bleeding was chronic and the other one was acute. I would like to know which type of bleeding is dangerous? And also explain the reason for the same.

### Response:I'm sorry to hear about your situation. Based on the information you provided, it seems like you are experiencing a stroke with associated bleeding. Strokes can be caused by two main types of bleeding: intracerebral hemorrhage and subarachnoid hemorrhage.

1. Intracerebral hemorrhage: This type of bleeding occurs within the brain tissue itself. It is often related to hypertension or vascular disease, where high blood pressure can cause blood vessels in the brain to rupture. The bleeding within the brain tissue can cause damage and lead to symptoms such as seizures, neurological deficits (weakness or paralysis), and changes in consciousness.

2. Subarachnoid hemorrhage: This type of bleeding occurs in the space between the brain and the thin tissues that cover it, known as the subarachnoid space. It is commonly caused by the rupture of an aneurysm (a weakened area in a blood vessel wall). The bleeding in the subarachnoid space can result in symptoms such as severe headache (often described as "thunderclap" in nature), nausea, vomiting, neck stiffness, and altered mental status.

In terms of which bleeding is more dangerous

input: Hi doctor,I am 21 and suffering from tinnitus from last four months. The sound in the ears is not constant. It is changing. Sometimes, it is loud enough that I can hear it even in a crowded place and sometimes so low I cannot detect in a normal environment and the most important of all with a loud noise like train horn it is taking a peak and when the sound goes off it comes back to normal. My doctor told me this is due to cold and prescribed some antibiotics. But it did not work. So he told me to visit an ENT specialist. After visiting an ENT specialist, he told me my ears are fine but I should do an audiogram. And also given me some antibiotics. There was no hearing loss in the audiogram. And the medicines also did not work. Then I again visited the doctor. This time he told me there is nothing to worry about and sent me back home. What I want to ask is, if there are any other tests that could detect why this is happening and how this could be treated?
raw_output:

### Instruction:

Sometimes, it is loud enough that I can hear it even in a crowded place and sometimes so low I cannot detect in a normal environment and the most important of all with a loud noise like train horn it is taking a peak and when the sound goes off it comes back to normal. My doctor told me this is due to cold and prescribed some antibiotics. But it did not work. So he told me to visit an ENT specialist. What I want to ask is, if there are any other tests that could detect why this is happening and how this could be treated?

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like you are experiencing subjective tinnitus, which is the perception of sound in the ears or head without any external sound source. Objective tinnitus, on the other hand, can be heard by a healthcare provider during an examination.

Tinnitus can have various causes, including exposure to loud noises, earwax build-up, certain medications, age-related hearing loss, and underlying medical conditions such as high blood pressure or diabetes. In some cases, the cause remains unknown.

To further investigate your tinnitus, I would recommend the following tests:

1. A detailed audiological evaluation: This test will assess your hearing thresholds and identify any hearing loss you may have. It can help determine if there is an underlying cause contributing to your tinnitus.

2. Imaging studies: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan or a computed tomography (CT) scan may be ordered to rule out any structural abnormalities in the brain or inner ear that could be causing the tinnitus.

3. Blood tests: These tests can help identify any systemic conditions that may be associated with or contributing to your tinnitus.

4. Assessment of noise exposure: Since loud noises can trigger or worsen tinnitus

input: Hello doctor,I had both my thyroid glands removed eight years ago, and a small amount was left (in the size of half of my small nail). Since then, I am getting my blood test done every year, which comes back normal. I do not understand this as everybody needs two thyroid glands to work properly, and a small amount of the gland is not enough to do the job. I suffer from tiredness, weight gain, and insomnia over these years.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I had both my thyroid glands removed eight years ago, and a small amount was left (in the size of half of my small nail). Since then, I am getting my blood test done every year, which comes back normal. I do not understand this as everybody needs two thyroid glands to work properly, and a small amount of the gland is not enough to do the job. I suffer from tiredness, weight gain, and insomnia over these years.

### Response:Based on the patient's description, it seems that they are experiencing symptoms related to hypothyroidism despite having their thyroid glands removed. It is important to note that while the thyroid gland plays a crucial role in regulating metabolism and various bodily functions, the body can still function with only a small portion of it.

However, the patient's symptoms of tiredness, weight gain, and insomnia could be indicative of an underactive thyroid. These symptoms are commonly associated with hypothyroidism, which occurs when the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormones.

To further evaluate the patient's condition, it would be advisable to conduct additional tests such as measuring thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels and free thyroxine (T4) levels. Elevated TSH levels and low T4 levels would suggest hypothyroidism.

If the test results confirm hypothyroidism, appropriate treatment options such as synthetic thyroid hormone replacement therapy can be considered to alleviate the symptoms and restore hormonal balance. It is important for the patient to consult with their healthcare provider for further evaluation and management.

### Response:As a doctor, I can provide some information regarding your question. 

Having sex during the days leading up to your period without using any form of contraception does increase the risk of pregnancy. Sperm can live inside the body for several days, and fertilization can still occur even if you are already ovulating.

However, it's important to note that there is no guarantee that you will get pregnant if you have unprotected sex during this time. Each woman's menstrual cycle is unique, and some may have a shorter or longer window for fertility.

To lower the risk of pregnancy, it is recommended to use contraceptives consistently and correctly. This can include methods such as condoms, birth control pills, intrauterine devices (IUDs), or hormonal implants. These methods are effective in preventing pregnancy when used correctly.

If you have concerns about your chances of getting pregnant or want more specific advice regarding your situation, I would encourage you to consult with a healthcare professional who can provide personalized guidance based on your medical history and reproductive health.

input: Hello doctor,I had chest pain. In my 2D echo report, septum jerky is given. What does is it mean? The doctor said the heart is fine.
raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,I had chest pain. In my 2D echo report, septum jerky is given. What does is it mean? The doctor said the heart is fine.

### Response:Based on the information provided, septal jerk is a finding on a 2D echo report. It refers to an abnormality in the movement or contraction of the septum, which is a wall that separates the left and right sides of the heart.

In normal circumstances, the septum contracts simultaneously with the rest of the heart during systole (the phase when the heart is contracting). However, in cases of septal jerk, there is an early and forceful contraction of the septum before the rest of the heart contracts. This results in a temporary disruption of blood flow within the heart.

Septal jerk is often associated with certain heart conditions, such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy or restrictive cardiomyopathy. It can also be seen in conditions that affect the conduction system of the heart, like ventricular arrhythmias.

Although the doctor said that the heart is fine based on the 2D echo report, it is important to consider the clinical context and other factors such as symptoms, medical history, and additional diagnostic tests to determine the underlying cause of the septal jerk. I would recommend discussing this finding with your doctor for further evaluation and management.

### Input:
Hi doctor,Whenever I yawn sometimes it feels like I pulled something, and on my bottom jaw I push on it and something goes up.

### Response:Based on the patient's description, it is possible that they are experiencing temporomandibular joint (TMJ) dysfunction. TMJ dysfunction can cause pain and discomfort in the jaw area, as well as a popping or clicking sensation when opening or closing the mouth. Yawning and chewing hard foods can also trigger these symptoms.

It is recommended for the patient to consult with a healthcare professional, such as a doctor or a dentist specializing in TMJ disorders, for a proper diagnosis and treatment options. They may suggest self-care measures like using warm compresses, practicing gentle jaw stretches, avoiding excessive jaw movement, and applying ice packs to help alleviate the symptoms. In some cases, physical therapy or splint therapy may be recommended to relieve stress on the joint and improve function.

The power chain is a metal chain connected to the brackets on your teeth, which provides additional force to guide tooth movement.

Again, the decision to incorporate these components into your treatment plan will be made by your orthodontist based on their assessment of your unique situation. They will explain when these additional appliances should be used and how often they need to be changed.

input: Hello doctor,My dentist went for a crown for my molar because my molar was too sensitive. Now the sensitivity has reduced but not gone completely. My crown was fixed before two years. What can I do?
raw_output:

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,My dentist went for a crown for my molar because my molar was too sensitive. Now the sensitivity has reduced but not gone completely. My crown was fixed before two years. What can I do?

### Response:Based on the information provided, there are a few possible reasons for your ongoing sensitivity after getting a crown. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Damaged or loose crown: It is possible that the crown could have become loose or damaged over time, allowing bacteria to enter the tooth and causing sensitivity. I would recommend visiting your dentist to check if the crown is intact and properly seated.

2. Irritated gums: If your gums have become irritated or inflamed around the crown, it can also contribute to sensitivity. Gum inflammation can be caused by plaque buildup or improper fit of the crown. Your dentist may need to perform a deep cleaning or adjust the crown to address this issue.

3. Inside tooth decay: In some cases, even with a crown in place, decay can still occur inside the tooth, leading to sensitivity. Your dentist may need to perform further examination and possibly take X-rays to assess the tooth structure and rule out any underlying decay.

4. Toothbrush abrasion: If you are using a hard-bristled toothbrush or aggressive brushing techniques, it is possible that you may have caused abrasion on the inner surface of the crown, leading to sensitivity. Your dentist may recommend using a gentler tooth

raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am a 24-year-male. My nose is growing towards the left side, and I want to know about rhinoplasty.

### Response:Rhinoplasty is a surgical procedure that can be performed to alter the shape, size, or function of the nose. It can help correct nasal contours that are misshapen due to genetics, trauma, or other factors.

As for your specific concern, a growing nose towards the left side may indicate a deviated septum. The septum is the cartilage that divides the nasal passages. A deviated septum can cause difficulty in breathing and a cosmetic issue where one side of the nose appears larger than the other.

Before considering rhinoplasty, it would be advisable to consult with a plastic surgeon or an otolaryngologist (ear, nose, and throat specialist) who can assess your situation further. They will evaluate the cause of your nose growth deviation and determine if a surgical intervention like rhinoplasty is necessary. They may also suggest non-surgical options such as septoplasty to correct the deviated septum if it is causing breathing difficulties.

It's important to remember that rhinoplasty is an elective procedure and should be carefully considered after discussing your goals and expectations with a medical professional. They will provide you with more information regarding the risks, benefits, and potential outcomes of the surgery.

1. If you ejaculate inside your partner without using a condom, there is a risk of pregnancy. Sperm can live inside the body for several days, and if intercourse occurs during this time, pregnancy can occur.

2. Pulling out alone is not considered a reliable method for preventing pregnancy. It does not guarantee that there will be no sperm left inside the vagina, which could lead to pregnancy.

3. To find the right condom size for you and your partner, it's important to try different types and brands. Look for condoms that feel comfortable and fit securely without causing pain or discomfort.

4. In addition to using condoms, there are natural methods of contraception that you can consider. These include the rhythm method (tracking menstrual cycles to determine fertile days), withdrawal method (pulling out before ejaculation), and cervical caps or diaphragms. However, it is essential to consult with a healthcare provider to determine the most suitable method for you and your partner.

5. To ensure there are no sperm remaining inside the vagina after intercourse, you can consider double-checking by taking a shower together or using a spermicide with condoms. However

Typically, you should only feel the heartbeat in the center of your chest, slightly to the left side. The presence of heartbeats on both sides may indicate a condition called "bilateral palpitation." This can be caused by several factors, such as anxiety, stress, excessive caffeine intake, dehydration, anemia, thyroid disorders, or certain medications. However, it can also be a symptom of a more serious underlying medical condition, such as heart valve disease, atrial fibrillation, or congenital heart defects.

I would recommend seeking medical attention to further evaluate your symptoms and determine the cause. A thorough physical examination, along with additional tests like an electrocardiogram (ECG) and echocardiogram, may be necessary to make an accurate diagnosis. It's important not to ignore these symptoms and consult with a healthcare professional for proper evaluation and guidance.

### Response:As a doctor, I can provide some information regarding your situation. Myopia, or nearsightedness, is a common refractive error in which distant objects appear blurry while near objects can be seen clearly. The progression of myopia is often genetically influenced and can worsen over time, especially during childhood and early adolescence.

While avoiding smoking and living a healthy lifestyle are important for overall health, there are additional measures you can take to slow down the progression of myopia. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Regular eye examinations: It is crucial to have regular eye check-ups with an optometrist or ophthalmologist to monitor your vision and assess any changes. They may recommend specific treatments or interventions based on your individual case.

2. Orthokeratology (Ortho-K): This non-surgical procedure involves wearing special contact lenses overnight to reshape the cornea and temporarily correct myopia. By doing so, it may help reduce the progression of myopia during sleep.

3. Atropine therapy: Atropine eye drops, when used daily, can temporarily paralyze the ciliary muscle in the eye, preventing it from contracting and thus slowing down the elongation of the

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi,I sprained my ankle while playing soccer. The ball hit the outside of my foot, causing my ankle to turn inward, and it popped few times. I also landed on it sideways in the same position. They took me to the hospital, where they told it was a moderate sprain. At first, it hurt to walk, but it did not hurt the following days. The doctor put me on crutches and a splint, which I only used for a day. It has been a week since I sprained it, there is still the pain in the top part of the ankle. The swelling went from none, to swollen to little swelling. I can play on it, but sometimes I feel pain. I have gone to my chiropractor twice, and it is still very tender around the top part of the ankle and the side of the leg, where those ligaments go upward. There is still slight pain while pointing my foot and turning it outward.My main concern is when I am sitting with my legs on the table, and when I try turning my ankle inward, I feel as though something in my ankle is shifting (like something is dislocated). My chiropractor tried adjusting the ankle, and it popped, but it did not affect the dislocated feeling. I have asked other people who I know have sprained their ankle, but they said they have never felt that. Should I be concerned? I am currently taking Advil.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi,I sprained my ankle while playing soccer. The ball hit the outside of my foot, causing my ankle to turn inward, and it popped few times. I also landed on it sideways in the same position. They took me to the hospital, where they told it was a moderate sprain. At first, it hurt to walk, but it did not hurt the following days. The doctor put me on crutches and a splint, which I only used for a day. It has been a week since I sprained it, there is still the pain in the top part of the ankle. The swelling went from none, to swollen to little swelling. I can play on it, but sometimes I feel pain. I have gone to my chiropractor twice, and it is still very tender around the top part of the ankle and the side of the leg, where those ligaments go upward. There is still slight pain while pointing my foot and turning it outward.My main concern is when I am sitting with my legs on the table, and when I try turning my ankle inward, I feel as though something in my ankle is shifting (like something is dislocated). My chiropractor tried adjusting the ankle, and it popped, but it did not affect the dislocated feeling. I have asked other people who I know have sprained their ankle, but they said they have never felt that. Should I be concerned? I am currently taking Advil.

### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you may have suffered a high ankle sprain. A high ankle sprain occurs when the ligaments above the ankle joint are injured, resulting in pain and swelling. The symptoms you described, such as pain when trying to turn your ankle inward and a shifting sensation, are consistent with a high ankle sprain.

It is important to seek further evaluation from a healthcare professional, such as an orthopedic specialist or sports medicine doctor. They will be able to conduct a thorough examination and possibly order imaging studies (such as an MRI) to confirm the diagnosis and determine the extent of the injury. Treatment for a high ankle sprain may include immobilization, physical therapy, and sometimes surgical intervention, depending on the severity.

In the meantime, it is advisable to avoid activities that aggravate the pain and consider using crutches or a brace to support the ankle during walking. Applying ice packs for 15-20 minutes at a time, several times a day, can help reduce swelling and alleviate discomfort. Over-the-counter pain medications like Advil can provide temporary relief, but it is best to consult with a healthcare professional for appropriate management of your symptoms.

input: Hello doctor,My grandmother is 83 years old and has been suffering from a mild form of glaucoma for three years now. When we consulted doctors earlier they suggested using eye drops than surgery. So we have been using Travo Z and Tear Drops daily and she is also able to see properly. Since one week she is experiencing pain in her eyes and has trouble looking at the light directly. Her eyes have also turned reddish. Please help.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,My grandmother is 83 years old and has been suffering from a mild form of glaucoma for three years now. When we consulted doctors earlier they suggested using eye drops than surgery. So we have been using Travo Z and Tear Drops daily and she is also able to see properly. Since one week she is experiencing pain in her eyes and has trouble looking at the light directly. Her eyes have also turned reddish. Please help.

### Response:Based on your description, your grandmother may be experiencing an acute attack of angle-closure glaucoma. This condition occurs when the drainage angle of the eye becomes blocked, leading to increased pressure inside the eye.

The symptoms you mentioned, such as pain, sensitivity to light, and redness, are consistent with angle-closure glaucoma. The use of eye drops alone may not be sufficient to control the intraocular pressure in cases like this.

I would strongly recommend that you take your grandmother to see an ophthalmologist immediately for further evaluation and treatment. Angle-closure glaucoma requires prompt medical attention to prevent permanent vision loss. The ophthalmologist may consider performing a laser procedure or surgery to improve the drainage of fluid from the eye and reduce the intraocular pressure.

Please seek medical attention as soon as possible.

Hello doctor,What is colon cleansing? Colon hydrotherapy has been advised, and how effective is the procedure? I have chronic constipation.

### Response:Colon cleansing, also known as colon hydrotherapy, is a procedure that involves flushing water through the colon to remove waste and toxins. It is typically done by a trained therapist in a clinical setting.

The purpose of colon cleansing is to remove accumulated fecal matter and gas from the colon, which supporters believe can help with digestion, improve nutrient absorption, reduce bloating, and address various health issues. However, there is limited scientific evidence to support these claims.

While colon cleansing may provide temporary relief for some individuals with chronic constipation, it is not considered a recommended treatment option by most healthcare professionals. Chronic constipation should be managed through dietary changes, increased water intake, regular exercise, and medications if necessary. It is important to consult with your doctor before undergoing any medical procedure, including colon hydrotherapy. They can evaluate your specific situation and provide appropriate guidance.
